infra_TrackEdge.description: A track edge is an uninterrupted stretch of railway track, without divergence or convergence.

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

trackEdgeLength.description: Distance along the TrackEdge's track centre line.

infra_TrackEdgeLink.description: Defines a relation between two track edges along which a train can run.

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

startOfA.description: True when linked to the start of track edge A, false when to the end

startOfB.description: True when linked to the start of track edge B, false when to the end

infra_TopoArea.description: Defines a container for rail network topology

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

infra_HorizontalLine.description: Geometric primitive for a horizontal linear segment

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

azimuth.description: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

infra_HorizontalArc.description: Geometric primitive for a horizontal arc of circle

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

azimuth.description: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

infra_HorizontalTransition.description: Geometric primitive for a horizontal transition curve, a clothoid.

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

azimuth.description: The azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

infra_HorizontalSegment.description: A curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a horizontal segment of the centre line of a railway track

infra_VerticalLine.description: Geometric primitive for vertical linear segment

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

slope.description: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

infra_VerticalArc.description: Geometric primitive for a vertical arc.

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

slope.description: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

infra_VerticalSegment.description: A curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a vertical segment of the centre line of a railway track

infra_CantPoint.description: Cant at a given location on the track.

trackGeometryPos.description: position on the associated track edge

appliedCant.description: Height of the right rail minus the left rail. Right/left with respect to the direction of the track edge. Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge)), gauge is distance between middle of the railheads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge '1435mm'

infra_TrackEdgeGeometry.description: Defines the geometry of the track edge centre line as a list of parametrised curves. The geometry is smooth; no discontinuities in azimuth or inclination.

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

items.description: Sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry
Sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry
trackEdge must be completely defined, at least at beginning and end. Empty means undefined

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

alignment3d.description: if true, all positions and length calculated on 3d line. if false - on 2d projection

infra_SlopeSamplePoint.description: Slope (gradient) of the track at a given location on the track.

samplePointSlope.description: The vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

infra_CurveSamplePoint.description: Curve (radius) of the track at a given location on the track.

infra_CantSamplePoint.description: Cant(superelevation) of the track at a given location on the track.

samplePointCant.description: Defines appliedCant as the Height of the right rail minus the left rail. Right/left with respect to the direction of the track edge. Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge), gauge is distance between centers of rail-heads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge.

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing
Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

items.description: composes of sampled track edge geometries

infra_TravelTimeMeasurementPoint.description: normally the passing time through a OperationalPoint is measured at the middle of it

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

sameDir.description: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

infra_LinkedPath.description: Defines a linked path on the topology

infra_PlatformEdge.description: Platform for the purpose of RINF is understood as a platform edge. A platform concerns only the part of the structure neighbouring to the track (interfaced with trains).

platformId.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

items.description: add only, if stopLocation can be used on that PlatformEdge for passenger/freight exchange

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

infra_OperationalPoint.description: An operational point (OP) means any location for train service operations, where train services may begin and end or change route, and where passenger or freight services may be provided; operational point also means any location at boundaries between Member States or infrastructure managers. In https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2019/773/oj 2.1.2 Principal locations (stations, yards, junctions, freight terminals).

uopId.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

opName.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

items.description: used to measure/define timestamps for passing trains. Stopping-timingPoints can be found via platforms.platformEdges.stopLocations and timingPoint.stopLocation

operationalPointType.description: Defines the type of Operational Point

items.description: the sequence of platforms is according to the real location, so neighbours are the same in array and reality

infra_SimplePoint.description: Defines the physical track asset Simple Point

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing ; structure refers to EULYNX EU.SAS.77

reversalTime.description: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

pointLeft.description: Track Edge Link referencing the left side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

pointRight.description: Track Edge Link referencing the right side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

infra_SlipCrossing.description: Defines the physical track asset Slip Crossing ; 2 instances simple point define a single slip crossing and 4 instances of simple point defined a double slip crossing ; Reversal time is the maximum of reversal times of simple points

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

infra_Derailer.description: Defines the physical track asset Derailer

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

reversalTime.description: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

derailToRight.description: if false = derailToLeft, the side at which the train will be derailed

infra_Crossing.description: Defines the physical track asset Crossing without possibility to switch between two track edges

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

isSwitchable.description: True: If the crossing is switchable ; False: If the crossing is not switchable ;https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Switched_diamond_crossings

infra_TrainDetector.description: Defines the train detector system for the train vacancy proving section

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

trainDetectorType.description: Defines the train detection system applicable for the TVPS

countUpDir.description: Direction in which axle counter counts up

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing
Identity of the object; used for referencing

nid_bg.description: national identifier of the balise group

nid_c.description: country identifier of the balise group

items.description: Defines the balises within the balise group. ETCS-positionInGroup is equal to the position this array

bgFunction.description: to be clarified, if derivable from baliseTelegram

linkOrientationDirection.description: defines linking orientation direction along the TrackEdge

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

markerFunctionStop.description: true=stop, false=location (when the ETCS marker is a location marker)

trainMaxWagons.description: including Locomotives, use zero if not defined

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

infra_TunnelTube.description: Defines the tunnels tubes within a tunnel. Main Use-Case identify emergency management with rescue into neighbour tube

crossSection.description: for calculation of air-resistance ; Standard Cross section dimensions corresponding to ATO Tunnel types will be defined later

infra_Tunnel.description: A railway tunnel is an excavation or a construction around the track provided to allow the railway to pass for example higher land, buildings or water.

tunnelIdentification.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

infra_Bridge.description: Defines the civil infrastructure object bridge

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

infra_Underpass.description: Defines the civil infrastructure object Underpass

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

infra_TvpSection.description: Defines the train vacancy proving section

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing ; structure refers to EULYNX EU.SAS.77

name.description: User-friendly name, only if different from id

infra_TrackArea.description: Defines a Track Area on the topology

infra_LevelCrossing.description: Defines the track asset level crossing

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

infra_NationalBorder.description: A border point is used to separate the railway network due to different reasons. Typical examples are country borders, the change of owning infrastructure manager or the border of a station

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

infra_DirTrackEdgePoint.description: Defines a directed spot location (without spatial expansion) on a Track Edge

pos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

sameDir.description: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

infra_BufferStop.description: Defines the object Buffer stop on the track

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

isSwitchable.description: true - if switchable ; false - if not switchable

infra_TrackEdgePoint.description: Defines a non-directed spot location (without spatial expansion) on a Track Edge

pos.description: position on the associated Track Edge

infra_TPActiveObject.description: A functional object infront of which a TimingPoint is located and active

timeMeasurePoint.description: refers to travel time measurement point

infra_TimingPoint.description: Defines a fixed point on the infrastructure

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

activeObject.description: composes of active timing points object

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

otherCategoryReplacesCantDeficiencySSP.description: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

otherCategoryDoesNotReplaceCantDeficienc.description: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

cantDeficiencyCategory.description: is of type Cant Deficiency Category

infra_SpecificStaticSpeedLimit.description: Defines the specific static speed profile for a section of track

speed.description: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

specificLimitCategory.description: defines different specific speed limit categories

infra_StaticSpeedLimit.description: Defines the static speed profile for a section of track

speed.description: Defines the applicable speed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

items.description: composes of specific static speed profiles

infra_AxleLoadSpeedProfile.description: Defines the axle load speed profile for a section of track

startPos.description: start position on the associated TrackEdge

endPos.description: end position on the associated TrackEdge

speed.description: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

items.description: composes of axle load speed profiles

infra_TrackEdgeSpeedProfile.description: Defines the permitted speeds for a Track edge in both directions

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

sameDirProfile.description: speed profile valid in the same direction as the trackEdge

oppositeDirProfile.description: valid in the opposite direction as the TrackEdge. Skip if the same in both directions.

infra_TrackEdgeGauge.description: inner distance between two rails, e.g. 1432 for EU-standard-rails

infra_TrackCondition.description: Defines the TrackConditions for a section of track

infra_CurrentLimitation.description: Defines max current for a list of track sections

infra_PermittedBrakingDistance.description: Defines max allowed braking distance for a list of track sections

distance.description: defines the applicable permitted braking distance

brakeType.description: defines the applicable brake type for braking

gradientValue.description: defines the gradient associated with the permitted braking distance

sameDir.description: usage direction of the TrackEdge ;true: active in same direction as trackEdge, false: active in opposite direction

infra_TrackEdgeSection.description: Defines a non-directed linear object (with a linear extension) located on a Track Edge

infra_TractionSystem.description: Defines the equipped traction system on the track

infra_PropertiesArea.description: the object itself contains default-values for the area. Exceptions are in trackConditions etc.

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

gauge.description: default gauge in the area. Deviations are covered in trackEdgeGauges

items.description: list of supported loading gauges per default
composes of track edge speed profiles
composes of track edge loading gauges

infra_TrackUsageArea.description: Preferred usage specification, most usable for TMS and planning

id.description: Identity of the object; used for referencing

versionTimestamp.description: version information which is valid since timestamp

items.description: track edges with preferred direction identical to the TrackEdge-Direction
track edges with preferred direction opposite to the TrackEdge-Direction
